data.title: Dragonfly - The Fastest In-Memory Data Store
data.description: Discover Dragonfly - the fastest in-memory data store for high-performance applications.
data.content:
Dragonfly - The Fastest In-Memory Data Store
===============

[**Register**](https://www.dragonflydb.io/events/2025-03-13-introducing-dragonfly-swarm) for our technical session to learn how Dragonfly Swarm achieves massive scale

Close

[![Image 1: Dragonfly](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logo-white.svg)![Image 2: Dragonfly](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logo.svg)](https://www.dragonflydb.io/)

*   [#### Community Edition Source-available, free forever.](https://github.com/dragonflydb/dragonfly)

### Featured blogs

[![Image 3: Announcing Dragonfly Swarm](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dragonflydb.io%2Fapi%2Fmedia%2Ffile%2Fannouncing-dragonfly-swarm-cover.png&w=3840&q=90) #### Announcing Dragonfly Swarm: Scaling In-Memory Data Without Limits](https://www.dragonflydb.io/blog/announcing-dragonfly-swarm-scaling-in-memory-data-without-limits)[![Image 4: Dragonfly vs. Valkey Benchmark: 4.5x Higher Throughput on Google Cloud Platform Cover](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dragonflydb.io%2Fapi%2Fmedia%2Ffile%2Fdragonfly-open-graph-post-dark.png&w=3840&q=90) #### Dragonfly vs. Valkey Benchmark: 4.5x Higher Throughput on Google Cloud](https://www.dragonflydb.io/blog/dragonfly-vs-valkey-benchmark-on-google-cloud)[![Image 5: cover](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dragonflydb.io%2Fapi%2Fmedia%2Ffile%2Fcover.png-3if0dj&w=3840&q=90) #### Efficient Context Management in LangChain Chatbots with Dragonfly](https://www.dragonflydb.io/blog/efficient-context-management-in-langchain-with-dragonfly)

In-memory¬†data¬†without¬†limits.¬†
===============================

Dragonfly is a drop-in Redis replacement that is designed for heavy data workloads running on modern cloud hardware. Migrate in less than a day and experience up to 25X better performance at 80% lower cost.

[Cloud Free Trial](https://dragonflydb.cloud/signup?__hstc=73252364.74d9b966368e0dc6e600575eaef1330a.1741500557078.1741500557078.1741500557078.1&__hssc=73252364.1.1741500557078&__hsfp=2836145088)[Download](https://www.dragonflydb.io/docs/getting-started)

Throughput in QPS

125k

3900k

SET

130k

3800k

GET

115k

4300k

SETEX

Redis

Dragonfly

QPS benchmark on AWS c6gn.16xlarge. Snapshot benchmark on AWS c6gn.4xlarge. [Source](https://github.com/dragonflydb/dragonfly#benchmarks).

![Image 6: Dragonfly triangle background](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/pages/homepage/triangle-bg.svg)

Trusted by developers from

*   ![Image 7: Buzzfeed](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logos/buzzfeed-grayscale.svg)
*   ![Image 8: Ubisoft](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logos/ubisoft-grayscale.svg)
*   ![Image 9: Epic](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logos/epicgames-grayscale.svg)
*   ![Image 10: jetBlue](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logos/jetblue-grayscale.svg)
*   ![Image 11: Wayfair](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logos/wayfair-grayscale.svg)

What developers are saying about Dragonfly
------------------------------------------

previous slidenext slide

![Image 12: Civa Kumar](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fciva-kumar.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Civa Kumar

Co-founder, SolidHash Inc

![Image 13: /assets/testimonials/solidhash.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/solidhash.svg)

Our service is data-intensive, demanding a database capable of sub-millisecond reads and fully leveraging our multi-core environment. After much research and benchmarking, Dragonfly emerged as the unparalleled choice. Since then, we've experienced a significant uptick in efficiency and reliability. Dragonfly's innovative technology has not only met our high-performance expectations but has also seamlessly integrated into our existing infrastructure, allowing us to scale our services like never before.

F

### Fernando Macho

Community Contributor

As you've seen from the counters, I'm a very heavy user of this in-memory database technology. I've gone through Redis, KeyDB, and finally Dragonfly, and I have no doubt that it's by far the best product I've ever used.

![Image 14: Micka√´l Stanislas](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fmickael-stanislas.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Micka√´l Stanislas

Design Engineer, Orange Business

![Image 15: /assets/testimonials/orange-business.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/orange-business.svg)

Dragonfly is a great Redis/Memcached alternative. Native to run in Kubernetes environments, scalable and easy to use. I use it in production and have no problems üëç https://dragonflydb.io

C

### Community Contributor

Engineer Enterprise Storage

Our recent migration to Dragonfly from our Redis instance has been nothing short of transformative for our company. The transition was mostly seamless, and the robust features of Dragonfly have elevated our database management to a new level. Our throughput is no longer bottlenecked, and now we no longer have to focus on constant hardware upgrades and we can focus on changing the world.

![Image 16: Ran Aroussi](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fran-aroussi.jpg&w=128&q=75)

### Ran Aroussi

Founder, Tradologics

![Image 17: /assets/testimonials/tradologics.png](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Ftradologics.png&w=640&q=75)

The fact that it's a drop-in replacement for Redis in terms of APIs and libraries made the decision super easy.

![Image 18: Gajus Kuizinas](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fgajus-kuizinas.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Gajus Kuizinas

Co-Founder, Contra

![Image 19: /assets/testimonials/contra.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/contra.svg)

Dragonfly's a game-changer for us: super efficient, smooth failover, and easy scaling‚Äîall without the usual headaches.

D

### Daniel K

Kick

![Image 20: /assets/testimonials/kick.png](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fkick.png&w=640&q=75)

Awesome support and features from Dragonfly.

C

### Community Contributor

Dragonfly has been my drop-in replacement for Redis for a few months now. There's a lot to love. We've saved significantly on infrastructure costs due to the vertical scaling capabilities and optimizations. The support team is responsive and has solved two of our bugs within a few days. Great work Dragonfly!

![Image 21: Pedro Maia](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fpedro-maia.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Pedro Maia

Founder & Director, GPM Participa√ß√µes & Tecnologias

![Image 22: /assets/testimonials/gpm.png](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fgpm.png&w=640&q=75)

One of the most significant advantages we've observed since switching to Dragonfly is the remarkable performance improvement. It has efficiently handled our large datasets and complex queries, significantly reducing data retrieval times.

![Image 23: Manuel (Manny) Ramirez Triana](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fmanuel-ramirez.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Manuel (Manny) Ramirez Triana

Founder & CTO

![Image 24: /assets/testimonials/megabyte.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/megabyte.svg)

After reviewing Redis and a few other solutions, it was an easy choice for Dragonfly to be a replacement where I did not have to refactor my code. Being able to have both Docker and the managed cloud service is also good. As my business grows, I am confident we can scale the Dragonfly deployments we have.

![Image 25: Valerio Barbera](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fvalerio-barbera.jpg&w=128&q=75)

### Valerio Barbera

Founder & CTO

![Image 26: /assets/testimonials/inspector.png](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Finspector.png&w=640&q=75)

I use Dragonfly as a queue broker. It's the most important component of our platform, and the ability to use all the CPU cores available on the server brought a significant performance improvement and cost savings.

![Image 27: Raine Scott](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fraine-scott.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Raine Scott

Founder

![Image 28: /assets/testimonials/verisoul.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/verisoul.svg)

We saw a 30X speedup compared to managed Redis and a 10X reduction in cost. It only took us about a day to integrate. No-brainer for anyone currently using Redis.

![Image 29: Annu Singh](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fannu-singh.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Annu Singh

Software Engineer & Developer Advocate

I'm impressed by Dragonfly because it is easy to use and has full compatibility with Redis APIs.

![Image 30: Denis Demchenko](https://www.dragonflydb.io/_next/image?url=%2Fassets%2Ftestimonials%2Fdenis-demchenko.jpeg&w=128&q=75)

### Denis Demchenko

CTO

![Image 31: /assets/testimonials/videoly.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/videoly.svg)

Our experience with Dragonfly has been extremely smooth and exciting! With Dragonfly Cloud, we replaced our huge and expensive self-hosted single-instance Redis-based cache on AWS with a faster, managed cluster on Dragonfly Cloud. This led to better application performance, 60% lower costs, and improved solution reliability. The migration was as easy as changing the endpoints from Redis to Dragonfly ‚Äî no code changes were required. Scaling clusters up and down is so easy and smooth!

A

### Alex Ioannides

Head of DevOps

![Image 32: /assets/testimonials/itrinity.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/itrinity.svg)

DragonflyDB has been a game-changer for our team. We were hitting performance bottlenecks with Redis due to its single-threaded nature, which limited our ability to scale efficiently. After switching to DragonflyDB, we immediately saw a significant boost in performance. Its multi-threaded architecture allowed us to handle the higher throughput we required.

V

### Vova E.

Senior Data Engineer

![Image 33: /assets/testimonials/kaspi-kz.svg](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/testimonials/kaspi-kz.svg)

DragonflyDB has been a game-changer for us in terms of performance and scalability. We needed a more powerful alternative to Redis that could handle large keys like hashmaps and sorted sets, and DragonflyDB has delivered impressively. We‚Äôre managing over 300GB of data with a load of up to 500k operations per second, and DragonflyDB has been able to handle it with ease. The scaling experience is significantly better as well. Plus, DragonflyDB offers full compatibility with Redis, which was a huge win for us. We have a large codebase, and the migration required no changes to our code‚ÄîDragonflyDB just worked seamlessly with our existing setup.

M

### Michele

Developer

Litterally just spent all night switching our system to Dragonfly DB. I love it. We went from 500ms response times for our API with Redis Search, to 150ms with Dragonfly. Also now we no longer have random queries that take 50ms

Dragonfly¬†delivers¬†25x¬†the¬†performance¬†of¬†legacy¬†software¬†
----------------------------------------------------------

The power of modern cloud hardware can never be realized with legacy software. Dragonfly is optimized for modern cloud computing, delivering 25x more throughput and 12x lower snapshotting latency when compared to legacy in-memory data stores like Redis, making it easy to deliver the real-time experience your customers expect.

### 25xMore QPS than Redis

Throughput (QPS)

3,970,000 QPS

148,000 QPS

### 12xFaster snapshotting than Redis

Snapshotting Speed (MB/s)

1,260 MB/s

107 MB/s

QPS benchmark on AWS c6gn.16xlarge. Snapshot benchmark on AWS c6gn.4xlarge. [Source.](https://github.com/dragonflydb/dragonfly#benchmarks)

Dragonfly

Redis

*   $1,500/month
    
    ![Image 34: Dragonfly Logo](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/logo-white.svg)
    
    ### Dragonfly Logo
    
*   $7,687/month
    
    ### Redis Enterprise
    
*   $6,394/month
    
    ### Elasticache
    

Based on a workload of 150GB with peak QPS at 450,000

Slash¬†Costs¬†
------------

Scaling Redis workloads is expensive due to their inefficient, single-threaded model. Dragonfly is far more compute and memory efficient, resulting in up to 80% lower infrastructure costs.

[Try Cloud Free](https://dragonflydb.cloud/signup?__hstc=73252364.74d9b966368e0dc6e600575eaef1330a.1741500557078.1741500557078.1741500557078.1&__hssc=73252364.1.1741500557078&__hsfp=2836145088)[Pricing](https://www.dragonflydb.io/pricing)

Simplify¬†Operations¬†
--------------------

Dragonfly scales vertically first, only requiring clustering at extremely high scale. This results in a far simpler operational model and a more reliable system.

[Try Cloud Free](https://dragonflydb.cloud/signup?__hstc=73252364.74d9b966368e0dc6e600575eaef1330a.1741500557078.1741500557078.1741500557078.1&__hssc=73252364.1.1741500557078&__hsfp=2836145088)[Learn more](https://www.dragonflydb.io/cloud)

![Image 35: Dragonfly supports vertical scaling](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/pages/homepage/df-cluster.svg)

### Dragonfly

VS

![Image 36: Redis cluster scaling](https://www.dragonflydb.io/assets/pages/homepage/redis-cluster.svg)

### Redis

Fully¬†compatible¬†with¬†Redis¬†APIs¬†
---------------------------------

Dragonfly is a drop-in Redis replacement, meaning it uses the same APIs and is compatible with all of the same SDKs and tooling. Teams that switch from Redis to Dragonfly get huge performance gains and a simpler system to operate, all without changing code.

Start¬†Building¬†Today¬†
---------------------

Dragonfly is fully compatible with the Redis ecosystem and requires no code changes to implement. Instantly experience up to a 25X boost in performance and 80% reduction in cost

[Sign up](https://dragonflydb.cloud/signup?__hstc=73252364.74d9b966368e0dc6e600575eaef1330a.1741500557078.1741500557078.1741500557078.1&__hssc=73252364.1.1741500557078&__hsfp=2836145088)[Request demo](https://www.dragonflydb.io/speak-to-sales)
